intro: Phanera ochroleuca, commonly known as the yellow-leafed phanera, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural gardens.
